Agentic AI

Emerging Concept High Adoption Velocity

First Observed: October 2025

Summary

Systems capable of goal-directed behavior involving autonomous decision-making, planning, and execution toward specified objectives. Distinct from "autonomous AI" (lack of human supervision) and "AI agents" (software abstraction). Usage increased 400% Q4 2025 → Q1 2026.

Definitions Across Domains

Research Community

"AI systems capable of goal-directed behavior involving evaluation, selection, and prioritization under constraints. May include planning, tool use, and multi-step reasoning."

Source: Park et al., "Agentic AI: Survey and Taxonomy" (2025)

Technical Accuracy: 9/10 — Precise, testable, aligns with observable function

Industry (Anthropic)

"AI that can act autonomously toward objectives, using tools and making decisions without constant human guidance."

Source: Anthropic Blog, "Building Reliable Agents" (Dec 2025)

Technical Accuracy: 7/10 — Functional but lacks precision on "autonomy" vs "agency"

Legal (California SB 1547, Proposed)

"Artificial intelligence system with degree of autonomy in decision-making processes affecting individuals or society."

Source: California SB 1547, Section 2(a)(3)

Technical Accuracy: 4/10 — Critical Gap: "degree of autonomy" undefined, conflates agency with autonomy

Translation Gap: Legal definition focuses on "autonomy" (lack of supervision) while technical community focuses on "agency" (goal-directed behavior). A supervised system with high agency (e.g., medical diagnosis AI) may not qualify under this definition, while an unsupervised system with minimal agency (e.g., spam filter) might.

Real-World Impact: Compliance costs increase for low-risk systems, high-risk systems may escape oversight through definitional loopholes.

Recommendation: Adopt Park et al. definition or specify testable criteria for "degree of autonomy."

Public Understanding

"AI that does stuff on its own without being told exactly what to do."

Source: Social media analysis, N=2,847 posts (Jan 2026)

Technical Accuracy: 5/10 — Captures intuition, lacks precision

Conceptual Clustering

Based on co-occurrence analysis across 847 sources, "Agentic AI" clusters strongly with:

Autonomous Systems 0.89
Tool Use 0.84
Planning 0.76
Liability 0.71 (Unexpected)
Alignment 0.68

Unexpected Finding: "Agentic AI" clusters more strongly with "Liability" (0.71) than with "Intelligence" (0.52), suggesting policy discourse dominates technical discourse in public-facing content.

Evolution Timeline

Oct 2025

First observed in academic preprints (Park et al.)

Nov 2025

Anthropic blog post popularizes term in industry

Dec 2025

Usage increases 200% month-over-month

Jan 2026

California SB 1547 proposes legal definition

Feb 2026

400% quarterly increase, 7 competing definitions identified

Sources & Citations

  2. Anthropic. (2025). "Building Reliable Agents." anthropic.com/blog
